string-array.name: quotes_from_euler
string-array.item: “Logic is the foundation of the certainty of all the knowledge we acquire.”
“Nothing takes place in the world whose meaning is not that of some maximum or minimum.”
“Madam, I have just come from a country where people are hanged if they talk.”
“For the sake of brevity, we will always represent this number 2.718281828459… by the letter e.”
“We pass by imperceptible gradations from the brute to the savage and from the savage to Euler and Newton.“
“The person who did most to give to analysis the generality and symmetry which are now its pride, was also the person who made mechanics analytical; I mean Euler.“
“Euler calculated without any apparent effort, just as men breathe, as eagles sustain themselves in the air.“
“Euler who could have been called almost without metaphor, and certainly without hyperbole, analysis incarnate.“
